main event: An airman observed a visual sighting of a single object in the sky, which was identified as a balloon launch on September 11, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as being all white with no sound and no disturbance of the power lines nearby., The object's altitude was estimated to be between 1200 and 1800 feet., The sighting lasted approximately two and a half minutes., The object was reported to be moving at an estimated speed of 175 to 200 miles per hour., Comments indicate that the case was closed after identifying the object as a normal balloon launch.
witness description: The witness was an airman with experience.
